interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Becoming Jane Review Date: 2008/02/09 Store: Anne Hathaway (Actor), James McAvoy (Actor), Julian Jarrold (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Miramax Home Entertainment, All Titles Product Description: ['Anne Hathaway (The Devil Wears Prada, The Princess Diaries) gives a radiant performance as a young, love-struck Jane Austen in the witty and engaging romantic comedy Becoming Jane from Miramax Films. It s the untold romance that inspired the novels of one of the world s most celebrated authors. When the dashing Tom Lefroy (James McAvoy, The Last King Of Scotland), a reckless and penniless lawyer-to-be, enters Jane s life, he offends the emerging writer s sense and sensibility. Soon their clashing egos set off sparks that ignite a passionate romance and fuel Jane s dream of doing the unthinkable marrying for love. Becoming Jane, also starring the acclaimed Maggie Smith, James Cromwell and Julie Walters, is an enchanting and imaginative film you ll fall head over heels for'] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Romance, Performing Arts', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Anne Hathaway, Julian Jarrold, James McAvoy', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 2.0)', 'Runtime': '2 hours', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Julian Jarrold', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours', 'Release date': 'February 12, 2008', 'Actors': 'Anne Hathaway, James McAvoy', 'Dubbed': 'Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Studio': 'Miramax', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: In this tale of Jane Austen's possible love of a man behind the scenes of the life we all know, we are shown a possible reason for the gut-wrenchingly romantic tales written by Ms. Austen. What we don't know, is the possible agony that might have led her to her tales of love.

This movie is beautiful and tragic all at the same time. I loved the movie, but found myself hopelessly sad for the rest of the evening. If you are single, please beware--this movie will leave you a little down, and not even a bowl of pasta can cure it's haunting message! I highly recommend this movie, but want any woman who is hopelessly in love with love to beware! You will most likely leave with cheeks wet, and eyes glistening with still to be shed tears. Just know what you're getting yourself into! Review Title: Singletons--BEWARE Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Dr. Quinn Medicine Woman - The Complete Season One Helene Udy (Actor), James Leland Adams (Actor), Terrence O'Hara (Director), Michele Lee (Director) & 1 more Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, A&E Home Video, All A&E Titles ['Product Description', 'From the moment that Dr. Michaela "Mike" Quinn (Jane Seymour) first stepped from the stagecoach into the mud of Colorado Springs, TV audiences had a new destination on Saturday nights.', 'Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman', 'won popular and critical acclaim--including five Emmy® awards--with its tales of courage, conviction and romance on the American frontier. When the show was cancelled after six seasons, it sparked one of the largest viewer protests in TV history.', "This comprehensive collector's set gathers all 17 episodes from the groundbreaking first season--plus a host of exclusive extras--on 5 DVDs. Old fans will delight in revisiting favorite moments, like Dr. Mike's first kiss from Sully (Joe Lando) and General Custer's visit to town, while newcomers will be captivated by the gripping, family-friendly stories and painstaking authenticity. Return to Colorado Springs for the unforgettable first season of Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman, available for the first time on DVD!", 'Amazon.com', 'Season one of', 'Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman', 'captures the popular television series at its most charming and original: a gently feminist, 19th-century Western with mythic overtones, a', 'Gunsmoke', '-like vision of small-town constancy, and an audacious love story that might best be described as Buckskin Bronte. British actress Jane Seymour scrubbed away her accent to play Michaela Quinn, fifth daughter of a well-to-do Boston physician who encouraged her to get a medical degree despite social obstacles.', "The headstrong Quinn moves to rough-and-tumble Colorado Springs to set up a practice, faces stiff resistance from the locals, witnesses the brutality of white America's expansionism, and generally experiences a classic Western transformation from privilege to pioneering. Along the way, Quinn makes a heartfelt connection with the mysterious Sully (Joe Lando), a laconic outsider/cowboy-knight-errant/widower preserving his broken heart. While the series' pilot may be the best thing in this set, there is a lot to enjoy about further episodes (with such guest stars as Johnny Cash and Robert Culp) exploring Quinn's hard-won admiration from town skeptics.", 'Dr. Quinn', 'creator Beth Sullivan admirably balances the many influences and narrative forces at work; some of the best shows are idea-driven, such as "Portraits," which deals with prejudice.', '--Tom Keogh'] {'Genre': 'Romance', 'Format': 'Box set, Color, NTSC, Full Screen', 'Contributor': "James Keach, Jerry Jameson, James Leland Adams, Michele Lee, Helene Udy, Alan J. Levi, Terrence O'Hara, Jerry London, Bethany Rooney, Chuck BowmanJames Keach, Jerry Jameson, James Leland Adams, Michele Lee, Helene Udy, Alan J. Levi, Terrence O'Hara, Jerry London, Bethany Rooney, Chuck Bowman See more", 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo), Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '5', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 3 inches; 1.1 Pounds', 'Director': "Terrence O'Hara, Michele Lee, Chuck Bowman, Jerry Jameson, James Keach", 'Media Format': 'Box set, Color, NTSC, Full Screen', 'Run time': '14 hours', 'Release date': 'May 27, 2003', 'Actors': 'Helene Udy, James Leland Adams', 'Studio': 'A&E Home Video', 'Number of discs': '5'} I have always been a huge fan of Dr. Quinn from the moment in came on TV. I have many of the episodes taped, but as any avid "tapers" will notice, over the years they get fuzzy, jumpy, etc. I am so THRILLED that they have finally put these jewels on DVD! I love the clean storytelling, and I love the new twist on the old west story. Season One really starts the story line off with Dr. Mike and Sully, as well as shows Micheala's knack at being a mother. I can watch these shows a million times, and I'm crossing my fingers that they release the rest of the seasons! Mad about Medicine Woman! Becoming Jane Anne Hathaway (Actor), James McAvoy (Actor), Julian Jarrold (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Miramax Home Entertainment, All Titles ['Anne Hathaway (The Devil Wears Prada, The Princess Diaries) gives a radiant performance as a young, love-struck Jane Austen in the witty and engaging romantic comedy Becoming Jane from Miramax Films. profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user maintains a strong affinity for classic television series and films that meld romance, history, and strong character development. They are particularly drawn to narratives that provide unique twists on traditional themes, often set in historical or Western contexts.

- **Viewing Behavior:** Enjoys family-friendly storytelling that emphasizes character growth and emotional connections, reflected in their appreciation for the relationships portrayed in both series and films.

- **Nostalgia and Collecting:** Shows a passion for nostalgia, frequently revisiting cherished childhood shows and films. Values comprehensive collections, such as complete seasons or editions with exclusive content, enhancing the overall viewing experience.

- **Rating Pattern:** The user consistently rates products highly, typically around 5.0, indicating a strong positive evaluation for quality and resonant storytelling.

- **Community Engagement:** Engages with content that fosters viewer loyalty and community discussions, showing an interest in the broader cultural impact of popular shows and films, including significant fan responses to cancelations.

- **Recent Interaction:** Recently expressed admiration for a romantic film with a tragic twist, noting its emotional depth and cautioning viewers about its potentially poignant effects. This reinforces their interest in narratives that evoke strong emotional responses related to love and longing.

Overall, the user possesses a deep connection to character-driven, heartwarming narratives from iconic television and film history, emphasizing the celebration of memorable storytelling.
